extensionDescription.message: Upload large attachments to your Cloud and send the link by email

serverUrl_details.message:
The base URL of the Cloud server must start with http or https.
If your server runs on a non-standard port, put it into the URL.

username_details.message: Your username on your Cloud server

password_details.message:
An app token (preferable) or password.
With Nextcloud only the Add-On tries to convert a user password into an app token before storing it. If that fails, your password is stored unencrypted.

storageFolder_details.message: The path where attachments will be are stored in your Cloud. If it doesn't exits, it's created during upload.

useNoDlPassword_details.message: No password is required for download

useGeneratedDlPassword_details.message: A random password will be generated for every file. Copy it from the status popup after upload.

useDlPassword_details.message: This password must comply to the rules the admin of your Cloud enforces (eg. length, character set, ...). Otherwise the upload will fail. Tell this password to the recipients; they will need it to download the attachment.

expiry_details.message: The number of days the download will be available, including today.

error_typeerror.message: No connection. Check Server URL and network connection.

error_404.message: Account verification failed: wrong username or incompatible cloud or network error.

warn_unsupported_cloud.message: Obsolete version of Nextcloud or ownCloud. You might lose data. Ask your cloud admin to update.

obsolete_version.description: This is displayed over the icon if the cloud version is not supported, so it should be quite short and contain at most two lines.

error_401.message: Login failed. Check username and password.

error_503.message: Server is in maintenance mode. Try again later.

error_sharing_off.message: Sharing is disabled on this cloud. Ask your admin to enable it.

error_invalid_pw.message: Invalid download password (uploads will fail). Server says: $1

error_password_enforced.message: Your cloud requires a download password.

warn_expiry_too_long.message: Your cloud admin has set a maximum expiry time of $1 days. The value was clipped, otherwise uploads would fail.

status_menuname.description: This is put after the *cloud logo to form the button in the message compose window that opens the progress popup window

status_button_clear.description: Button to remove messages from status popup

status_error.description: The $1 will be replaced with one of the states above, eg 'Sharing failed'. You may put text before and after it. If this doesn't work in your language, please tell me.

warn_nonascii_password.message: Your password contains characters that are likely to cause login problems. Use an app password instead.
